senses.de: To place something over or on top of something
senses.ex: She used a blanket to cover the baby.

Tips.title: Physical concealment
Tips.description: Use 'cover' to talk about hiding or protecting something by putting it under another thing.
Tips.example: He covered the leftover food with foil.

Tips.title: Implicit protection
Tips.description: Something covered is often shielded from harm, like covering a wound.
Tips.example: You should cover the cut to prevent infection.

Tips.title: Disguise
Tips.description: Cover can mean to disguise something’s true appearance or nature.
Tips.example: They covered the old walls with a fresh coat of paint.

senses.de: To deal with a particular subject or topic
senses.ex: The book covers the basics of programming.

Tips.title: Scope of content
Tips.description: ‘Cover’ often refers to the range or breadth of material tackled.
Tips.example: Our history class covers the period from the Renaissance to the present.

Tips.title: Depth of discussion
Tips.description: Can imply varying depth, from a brief mention to a thorough exploration.
Tips.example: Does this article cover the cause of the crisis in detail?

senses.ex: He covered 300 miles in two days.

Tips.title: Geographical journeys
Tips.description: Use 'cover' to describe the extent of a journey over distance.
Tips.example: The delivery service covers the entire city.

Tips.title: Measure progression
Tips.description: Can be used to measure progress in reaching a point or completing routes.
Tips.example: How much ground do we need to cover before we reach the camp?

senses.de: The outside part or uppermost layer of something
senses.ex: He put a cover on the book to protect it.

Tips.title: Physical layer
Tips.description: A 'cover' can be a tangible layer that sits on something else.
Tips.example: Put a cover on your tablet to protect the screen.

Tips.title: Concealment
Tips.description: As a noun, 'cover' sometimes means an attempt to conceal something.
Tips.example: He used his charm as a cover for his lack of experience.

senses.de: To protect or defend someone by providing security
senses.ex: Our insurance covers damage from natural disasters.

Tips.title: Financial safety
Tips.description: In legal or insurance terms, ‘cover’ suggests providing financial safety or reimbursement.
Tips.example: Will my travel insurance cover lost luggage?

Tips.title: Extent of protection
Tips.description: Understand the details to know what is included or excluded in coverage.
Tips.example: This warranty does not cover accidental damage.

senses.de: To play or perform a version of a song originally done by someone else
senses.ex: She covered a famous song by The Beatles at the concert.

Tips.title: Musical rendition
Tips.description: A 'cover' in music means performing a song made popular by another artist.
Tips.example: His cover of the classic hit brought him fame.

Tips.title: Creative interpretation
Tips.description: Covering a song can involve personal interpretation, giving it a new style.
Tips.example: She loves covering old jazz songs in a modern way.

Blanket.wordDefinition:
A blanket is usually used for warmth or comfort and is made of thicker material. It's often used while sleeping, on sofas, or for outdoor activities such as camping.

A cover can be used to conceal or protect an object or piece of furniture. It's often made of thinner material than a blanket and is designed to fit a specific item, such as a sofa cover, car cover, or book cover.

A blanket is used for warmth and comfort, while a cover is used for protection or concealment.

Coat.wordDefinition:
Coat is usually used to refer to a piece of clothing worn over other garments to keep a person warm. For example, a winter coat is worn over a shirt or sweater to protect from the cold.

Coat refers to a specific garment used for warmth, while cover is a general term that can refer to a variety of items used to protect or hide something else.

Conceal.wordDefinition:
Conceal means to hide something completely. It suggests that the item or information is deliberately and carefully hidden so it cannot be seen or found.

For example, a spy might conceal a secret document in a hidden compartment in a book.

Conceal means hiding something completely, while cover means placing something over or around something else.

Envelop.wordDefinition:
Envelop means to completely surround or enclose something. For example, a letter or package is enveloped in an envelope or a cocoon envelops a caterpillar as it transforms into a butterfly.

Cover usually means to place something over the top to protect or hide it while envelop means to surround or enclose something completely.

Hide.wordDefinition:
Hide means to conceal or keep something secret.

It can be used when you want to keep something out of sight, for example, you might hide a present under your bed. In other cases, it can describe the act of taking shelter in order to avoid danger or harm, for example, you might hide behind a tree during a game of hide and seek.

Cover is used when you want to protect or conceal something, while hide is used when you want to keep something out of view or avoid danger.

Mask.wordDefinition:
Mask means to hide or obscure something completely by covering it up or putting on a disguise. For example, wearing a mask for a costume party or wearing a face mask to protect against germs.

In general, we use cover to protect and mask to hide.

Protect.wordDefinition:
Cover means to place something over another thing, often to conceal or hide it. For example, a book cover is put over a book to protect it from damage or dirt.

Protect means to prevent something from being harmed or damaged. For example, a helmet protects the head from getting injured during activities like biking or skateboarding.

The main difference between the two is that cover is putting something on top of another thing while protect is doing something to keep something else safe.

Shelter.wordDefinition:
Shelter typically refers to a place that offers protection or a safe place to stay in. For example, a building or tent can provide shelter from adverse weather conditions.

Shelter can also refer to a place that provides refuge or assistance for those in need such as a homeless shelter.

Cover is generally used to describe protection from the elements or concealment, while shelter refers to a place that provides protection or assistance.

Veil.wordDefinition:
Veil means to cover or wrap something completely, especially with a fabric that is translucent or opaque.

A veil is often worn over a person's face, for example, a bride's veil at a wedding.

Veil is applicable to situations where you want to conceal the appearance or identity of something or someone.

Wrap.wordDefinition:
Wrap, on the other hand, means to enclose an object completely by putting a material (such as paper or plastic) around it.

For example, you might wrap a gift in wrapping paper, or wrap leftovers in plastic wrap.

Cover implies a partial or temporary covering, while wrap implies a complete or more permanent covering.

quotes.Text: There were a lot of areas we didn't cover that I'm hoping to cover if we do some specials. One is to see more of Patsy's home and her home life, which is just the saddest thing.
quotes.Title: British Comedian
quotes.Name: Jennifer Saunders

quotes.Text: Nixon clearly broke laws. He clearly believed he needed to stay in power to protect the country. But he recognized that he was breaking the law, and he tried to cover it up.
quotes.Title: American Historian
quotes.Name: Heather Cox Richardson

quotes.Text: The world is such a big place, and there's so much that goes on, but a lot of the media really just cover the same thing over and over again.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Jenna Bush

quotes.Text: I love film, and I think it's so important for kids to be educated about films and real life subjects that films cover.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: Nico Mirallegro

quotes.Text: The easiest thing to do in the world is pull the covers up over your head and go back to sleep.
quotes.Title: American Wrestler
quotes.Name: Dan Gable

quotes.Text: A 'Cosmo' cover has been my dream my entire life. I cried when I found out.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Kaley Cuoco

quotes.Text: Record covers helped me discover a lot of music that I wasn't aware of.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Martin Gore

quotes.Text: I rarely have any contact with the artists who cover my songs.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: J. J. Cale

quotes.Text: I've been on the cover of every magazine in the world.
quotes.Title: American Model
quotes.Name: Janice Dickinson

quotes.Text: I wanted to be on the cover of Life magazine.
quotes.Title: American Soldier
quotes.Name: Ed Dwight
